subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: air
author: RetroCom
full_text:
Hi Margaret, ask Arthur if by 'air' he is refering to aether/ether. This is the energy that could be surrounding all matter.
Great session BTW :-)
Dave

--- ITCdeadpeople@... wrote:

From: "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: air
Date: Wed, 02 Apr 2008 22:25:22 -0000

Hi Stefan.  I don't think 'air' means soundwaves in this case.  And I'm in agreement with 
you, that I don't think sound is the key in the technique (though I suspect it to be with the 
Portuguese crowd babble background and Voice 2000s DA300 recorder combo.)

I'm going to try to get more specific answers about what exactly 'air' is from Arthur's 
perspective.  

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Margaret,
> 
> could 'air' perhaps mean 'sound waves'? Although I personally don't
> think that sound is the key.
> 
> Stefan
> 
> -- 
> 
> > Hi Bruce.  I hear most the content in your clips as you are.  On this one, I believe it 
says, "I
> > will get us AIR speech."  I have repeatedly been told with this method that 'air' has 
> > something to do with the communication.  
> 
> > Not sure what Arthur's definition of 'air' is, but it is definitely key to what is taking 
place.  
> > He's used terms and phrases like "Air-to-air" - "Air Ports" - "Air Portals" - "Helps you 
> > enter our air" - "They'll give you air to us" - "I have air" etc.  MANY references.
> 
> > Margaret
>
